intro: Psilostrophe bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's psilostrophe, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces seeds in small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
